definition: the younger generation/those who come after
lifetime/generation/group of people/class/classifier for generations/(literary) classifier for people

sentences.english: The lion roared one last time, and we were all his cubs.
sentences.chinese: 我們作爲晚輩，聆聽着這頭雄獅最後一次的咆哮。

sentences.english: As a junior, you should go to visit your ailing uncle.
sentences.chinese: 作爲晚輩，你理該去看望生病的叔叔。

sentences.english: According to ancient manners, the juniors should sit on the right side of the superiors.
sentences.chinese: 中國古代禮儀要求晚輩坐在長輩下首。

sentences.english: This old man loves his inferiors very much, for they are his hope.
sentences.chinese: 這個老人非常愛他的晚輩，因爲他們是他的希望。

sentences.english: Those thou create are thine own childer.
sentences.chinese: 那些你所創造出的吸血鬼是你的晚輩。

sentences.english: Then slowly tell side juniors, I go, there is no.
sentences.chinese: 然後慢騰騰地告訴身旁的晚輩，我走了，就沒有了。

sentences.english: Let those who are older go first, the younger ones should follow behind.
sentences.chinese: 總是禮讓長輩在先，晚輩居後。

sentences.english: So respect your elders, minors, and everyone in between.
sentences.chinese: 因此尊重長輩，晚輩和其他所有人。

sentences.english: As a junior, we should respect the old.
sentences.chinese: 作爲一個晚輩，我們應該尊敬老人。

definition: of the same generation/person of the same generation/peer
to give a present/to accord (a favor)/to grant
to lead by the hand/to guide/to support
